laboratory_examinations.findings: Blood level was 119 U per liter (reference range, 30 to 100); outside normal range.
Showed residual T2-weighted hyperintensity along the margin of the resection cavity.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual development of abnormal, nonenhancing, mildly expansile tissue with T2-weighted hyperintensity was noted.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Revealed IDH1 R132H mutation and presence of MGMT gene promoter methylation.
Showed stable appearance and extent of signal abnormality in infiltrative neoplasm.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRIs after chemotherapy showed a decrease in the degree of infiltration and extent of abnormal tissue.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Ki-67 proliferation index was 9%, higher than typically associated with WHO grade II oligodendrogliomas.
